Where can I get help setting up a currency launch on Verus?
You can get help setting up a currency launch on Verus by joining the Verus Discord #pbaas-development channel, where the community is happy to assist.

# Launch currencies::: warning Need help setting up a currency launch? 🤔
[Go to the Verus Discord #pbaas-development channel. The community is happy to assist!](https://www.verus.io/discord)
:::![image-currencies-launching](/images/launching-currencies.png)This is what a (simple) currency definition looks like:``` json
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{
 "name":"MyBrand", 
 "options":32, 
 "proofprotocol":2, 
 "preallocations":[{"Klaus@":100}]
}'
```The above command is processed into a HEX, and that HEX is broadcasted to the network. Simultaneously the fees are taken from the rootID (and distributed among the block producers) and after waiting a minimum period of 20 blocks the currency is launched and ready to be used by the worldwide network.## VerusID namespace
To launch a currency on Verus (and any other PBaaS-chain) a namespace is needed. That namespace is a VerusID. The namespace is the name of the currency (e.g. ``MyBrand@``). That namespace can also have subIDs (e.g. ``product.MyBrand@``, ``user.MyBrand@``). The controller of this VerusID is the only one who can create a currency of that name, and they can only do so once.On Verus a VerusID registration costs between 20 and 100 VRSC, and the launch of a currency costs 200 VRSC. These costs are always paid in the chain’s native coin (to the worldwide miners and stakers). On other PBaaS-chains these costs can differ since the chain launcher can define its own costs for VerusID registrations and currency launches.## Defining options
To define a currency, choose options. Then combine these options to whatever the currency needs to be. Just add the numbers together in the currency definition. The currency options are listed below.
./raw_text_input_docs/launch-currency.md
What is the basic format of a currency definition on Verus, and how is it processed?

A simple currency definition on Verus looks like this:
```json
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{
 "name":"MyBrand", 
 "options":32, 
 "proofprotocol":2, 
 "preallocations":[{"Klaus@":100}]
}'
```
When you run this command, it is processed into a HEX, which is then broadcasted to the network. The fees for this transaction are taken from the rootID and distributed among the block producers. After a minimum of 20 blocks, the currency is launched and ready to be used by the worldwide network.

What is the purpose of a VerusID namespace in launching a currency on Verus or a PBaaS chain?

A VerusID namespace is required to launch a currency on Verus or a PBaaS chain. This namespace is a VerusID that serves as the name of the currency (e.g., "MyBrand@"). The controller of this VerusID is the only one who can create a currency with that name, and they can only do so once. The namespace can also have subIDs (e.g., "product.MyBrand@", "user.MyBrand@").

./raw_text_input_docs/launch-currency.md
What are the costs associated with launching a currency on Verus, and how are they paid?

On Verus, the cost of registering a VerusID is between 20 and 100 VRSC, and the cost of launching a currency is 200 VRSC. These costs are always paid in the chain's native coin (to the worldwide miners and stakers). Note that these costs may differ on other PBaaS chains, as the chain launcher can define their own costs for VerusID registrations and currency launches.

How do I define options for a currency on Verus?

To define a currency on Verus, you choose options that suit your needs and combine them by adding their corresponding numbers together in the currency definition. The available currency options are listed, and you can select the ones that fit your currency's requirements.
